page.title: 06WATER EATON DOVECOTE
page.content: The dovecote stands in the middle of a field in front of Water Eaton Manor.It is square.This is a rare shape for a dovecote,the only other known example being at the White Hart pub at Wytham.The dovecote is made out of stone.It has a wooden door and there is a resting place for birds at the top.Inside there are nesting boxes for 300 birds but in 1985 there are no birds nesting there.Passing alonmgside the dovecote is a path which is said to be part of the pilgrims' way to Cambridge.
